title: We're All Just A Bunch Of ANIMALS
body_text:
The 5th Annual FAMILY AFFAIR
- also referred to in promotional posters as
FAMILY AFFAIR V
or
FAMILY AFFAIR 5
- was the astounding 190th event produced within the
Tronolone Era
of
East Coast Dodgeball
. It was the 170th event scheduled on a Saturday and the second in the annual tradition to take place during the summer season (FAMILY AFFAIR III, July 2010).
For the first time in FAMILY AFFAIR history, paper invitations were not included in the event promotion. In lieu of such, Facebook notifications and reminders, text messages, emails, and other forms of media contributed to the community outreach.
The outing commenced at 5:30pm and lasted for four and a half hours when the Wall High School tennis courts lights automatically powered off at 10.
East Coast Dodgeball's
meanest, nastiest, and baddest animals battled it out in this barbaric war for all the marbles. An encounter almost one full agonizing year in the making, "The Big Kat"
Zach Katz
clashed with "The Wolf Man"
Justin Wolf
and trust that casualties were at an all-time high ..
MATCH SUMMARY & SCORE
Wolf perpetrated the initial attack, securing Round 1 to capture the early advantage. Katz quickly came back however and tied it all up at 1 apierce. In the classic two-team finale, Wolf altered the momentum to his hand-chosen wolfpack yet again to retake the pivotal third game.
Prison Ball, a Katz favorite, was instituted beginning with Game 4 and the melee didn't cease there.
While Katz's "eye of the tiger" mentality grabbed him three additional victories, that "Big Bad Wolf" never relinquished the lead for the remainder of FAMILY AFFAIR.
Justin Wolf
defeated
Zach Katz
, 7 - 4, at the 5th Annual FAMILY AFFAIR.
Wolf: 1, 3-5, 7, 9, 11 | Katz: 2, 6, 8, 10
FAMILY AFFAIR just wouldn't have been the same without those cherished loved ones cheering on! And so for the fifth consecutive year, beloved relatives and dear friends joined for the fun-filled showcase of athletic competition.
→ the revered matriarch of the Adams clan,
Gaile
*, with a delicious brownie-filled platter in hand!
→ Jason Teitelbaum's motorcycle-ridin' buddy,
Matt Zillante
*
→ Dan Spengeman's support team of his girlfriend
Michelle Mullins
and neighbors, sisters
Saralyn and Emma Switzer
→ the energetic runt of the Letsche brigade, three year-old
Brody
*
→ Zach Berghoff and Alysha Kelly's companion
Erica Briden
→ proud father of the re-emerging Rob Avakian,
Tom
→ Joanice Lima, Chris Adams, and John Tronolone's intense Ocean Township volleyball teammate/opponent,
Uender Marques
*
→ Kevin Adams' favorite gal
Prerna Sinha
→ headliner Justin Wolf's Utah pal,
Brian Dunn
→ leading general Zach Katz's parents
Allan and Star
as well as his girlfriend,
Alex Brummell
*
* = also participated
As if FAMILY AFFAIR needed anything more, it was also Captain
Justin Wolf's 26th birthday
! He was given full creative control over the musical soundtrack with "This Is Gonna Hurt" by Hoobastank his choice for the event theme. A posterboard-sized birthday card was signed by all attendees throughout the evening and presented to him following the conclusion of FAMILY AFFAIR.
Diehard dodgeballers and sideline crowd members of this 5th annual spectacular had the perfect opportunity to make a major impact in the fight against Alzheimer's Disease. For a suggested $1 donation, each contributor received a miniature
ClifBar
as a token of appreciation.
Well, the ever-generous
ECD
Community proved fruitful yet again as players and spectators collectively gathered an incredible
$65 for the Alzheimer's Association
! As of June 24, 2012, each and every penny has already been donated to the worthy cause.
Please visit the
Alzheimer's Association "Walk To End Alzheimer's"
official page for the report.
ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
"Thank You" to the following supporters: the Katz Family, Alex Brummell, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Kenny Jacobs, Alysha Kelly, Zach Berghoff, John Tronolone, Kelly Oberto, Gaile Adams, Chris & Joanice Adams, Prerna Sinha, Juan Londono, Pam D'Luhy, Dan Spengeman, Michelle Mullins, the Switzer Sisters, Kevin Megill, Ryan Letsche, Lauren Stopa, and Justin Pierce.
FAMILY AFFAIR V attracted
twenty-six participants
, tied for the most of any 2011 outing and the highest attendance of the 2012 season thus far. The impressive turnout comprised of 19 men and 7 women.
Of the total 26,
five combatants
made their
ECD
debut: Alex Brummell, Brody Letsche, Gaile Adams, Matt Zillante, and Uender Marques.
ECD's
grand player count has reached an unpredented 490.
CAPTAINCY RECORDS
The triumphant "Wolf Man" lifts his record to 2-4-1. This was his first singles win since his debut captains contest versus Ryan Letsche at DODGEBALL 109 in October 2007. More importantly, he became the first
ECD
captain to main event
two
FAMILY AFFAIR extravaganzas having battled Juan Londono at the very first of such in May 2008.
"The Big Kat" unfortunately slides to 1-2-0. Despite the loss, he too made monumental
ECD
history by shattering the record for longest drought between captains contests: 6 years, 3 months, 2 weeks! This was his very first season finale-equivalent headlining event.
The match-up between Katz and Wolf was originally slated for ANNIVERSARY 6 in September 2011, but a scheduling conflict between
ECD
and Katz postponed the big time main event to a later date.
________________________________________
______________________
JULY and AUGUST Events
Friday, July 13 | 5:30pm
Yeah, it might be Friday the 13th but luck will not have anything to do with this half-decade war. The famed
WALL v. ALL
main attraction is all set for this mid-summer showdown. Prep yourselves for Round 12!
Saturday, August 4 | 5:30pm
Entitled CLASH OF THE TITANS, brace yourself for the god-like collision of a lifetime. It will be epic - promise. Furthermore, the
ECD
Community will say its final goodbyes to the newly-married Chris and Joanice Adams who, soon after, will depart for their home residency in beautiful Brazil.
body_html:
The 5th Annual FAMILY AFFAIR - also referred to in promotional posters as FAMILY AFFAIR V or FAMILY AFFAIR 5 - was the astounding 190th event produced within the Tronolone Era of East Coast Dodgeball. It was the 170th event scheduled on a Saturday and the second in the annual tradition to take place during the summer season (FAMILY AFFAIR III, July 2010).

For the first time in FAMILY AFFAIR history, paper invitations were not included in the event promotion. In lieu of such, Facebook notifications and reminders, text messages, emails, and other forms of media contributed to the community outreach.

The outing commenced at 5:30pm and lasted for four and a half hours when the Wall High School tennis courts lights automatically powered off at 10.



East Coast Dodgeball's meanest, nastiest, and baddest animals battled it out in this barbaric war for all the marbles. An encounter almost one full agonizing year in the making, "The Big Kat" Zach Katz clashed with "The Wolf Man" Justin Wolf and trust that casualties were at an all-time high ..

MATCH SUMMARY & SCORE
Wolf perpetrated the initial attack, securing Round 1 to capture the early advantage. Katz quickly came back however and tied it all up at 1 apierce. In the classic two-team finale, Wolf altered the momentum to his hand-chosen wolfpack yet again to retake the pivotal third game.

Prison Ball, a Katz favorite, was instituted beginning with Game 4 and the melee didn't cease there.

While Katz's "eye of the tiger" mentality grabbed him three additional victories, that "Big Bad Wolf" never relinquished the lead for the remainder of FAMILY AFFAIR.

Justin Wolf defeated Zach Katz, 7 - 4, at the 5th Annual FAMILY AFFAIR.

Wolf: 1, 3-5, 7, 9, 11 | Katz: 2, 6, 8, 10



FAMILY AFFAIR just wouldn't have been the same without those cherished loved ones cheering on! And so for the fifth consecutive year, beloved relatives and dear friends joined for the fun-filled showcase of athletic competition.

→ the revered matriarch of the Adams clan, Gaile*, with a delicious brownie-filled platter in hand!
→ Jason Teitelbaum's motorcycle-ridin' buddy, Matt Zillante*
→ Dan Spengeman's support team of his girlfriend Michelle Mullins and neighbors, sisters Saralyn and Emma Switzer
→ the energetic runt of the Letsche brigade, three year-old Brody*
→ Zach Berghoff and Alysha Kelly's companion Erica Briden
→ proud father of the re-emerging Rob Avakian, Tom
→ Joanice Lima, Chris Adams, and John Tronolone's intense Ocean Township volleyball teammate/opponent, Uender Marques*
→ Kevin Adams' favorite gal Prerna Sinha
→ headliner Justin Wolf's Utah pal, Brian Dunn
→ leading general Zach Katz's parents Allan and Star as well as his girlfriend, Alex Brummell*
* = also participated

As if FAMILY AFFAIR needed anything more, it was also Captain Justin Wolf's 26th birthday! He was given full creative control over the musical soundtrack with "This Is Gonna Hurt" by Hoobastank his choice for the event theme. A posterboard-sized birthday card was signed by all attendees throughout the evening and presented to him following the conclusion of FAMILY AFFAIR.



Diehard dodgeballers and sideline crowd members of this 5th annual spectacular had the perfect opportunity to make a major impact in the fight against Alzheimer's Disease. For a suggested $1 donation, each contributor received a miniature ClifBar as a token of appreciation.

Well, the ever-generous ECD Community proved fruitful yet again as players and spectators collectively gathered an incredible $65 for the Alzheimer's Association! As of June 24, 2012, each and every penny has already been donated to the worthy cause.

Please visit the Alzheimer's Association "Walk To End Alzheimer's" official page for the report.

ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
"Thank You" to the following supporters: the Katz Family, Alex Brummell, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Kenny Jacobs, Alysha Kelly, Zach Berghoff, John Tronolone, Kelly Oberto, Gaile Adams, Chris & Joanice Adams, Prerna Sinha, Juan Londono, Pam D'Luhy, Dan Spengeman, Michelle Mullins, the Switzer Sisters, Kevin Megill, Ryan Letsche, Lauren Stopa, and Justin Pierce.



FAMILY AFFAIR V attracted twenty-six participants, tied for the most of any 2011 outing and the highest attendance of the 2012 season thus far. The impressive turnout comprised of 19 men and 7 women.

Of the total 26, five combatants made their ECD debut: Alex Brummell, Brody Letsche, Gaile Adams, Matt Zillante, and Uender Marques. ECD's grand player count has reached an unpredented 490.

CAPTAINCY RECORDS
The triumphant "Wolf Man" lifts his record to 2-4-1. This was his first singles win since his debut captains contest versus Ryan Letsche at DODGEBALL 109 in October 2007. More importantly, he became the first ECD captain to main event two FAMILY AFFAIR extravaganzas having battled Juan Londono at the very first of such in May 2008.

"The Big Kat" unfortunately slides to 1-2-0. Despite the loss, he too made monumental ECD history by shattering the record for longest drought between captains contests: 6 years, 3 months, 2 weeks! This was his very first season finale-equivalent headlining event.

The match-up between Katz and Wolf was originally slated for ANNIVERSARY 6 in September 2011, but a scheduling conflict between ECD and Katz postponed the big time main event to a later date.

______________________________________________________________

JULY and AUGUST Events

Friday, July 13 | 5:30pm
Yeah, it might be Friday the 13th but luck will not have anything to do with this half-decade war. The famed WALL v. ALL main attraction is all set for this mid-summer showdown. Prep yourselves for Round 12!

Saturday, August 4 | 5:30pm
Entitled CLASH OF THE TITANS, brace yourself for the god-like collision of a lifetime. It will be epic - promise. Furthermore, the ECD Community will say its final goodbyes to the newly-married Chris and Joanice Adams who, soon after, will depart for their home residency in beautiful Brazil.
